required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Collection of Human Tissue Samples From the Neck Region for Characterization of Its Molecular and Biochemical Signatures
clinical_study.official_title: Collection of Human Tissue Samples From the Neck Region for Characterization of Its Molecular and Biochemical Signatures

lead_sponsor.agency: Translational Research Institute for Metabolism and Diabetes, Florida

clinical_study.source: Translational Research Institute for Metabolism and Diabetes, Florida

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to gather tissue (from the neck region), specimens (blood and urine) and medical record data from many patients and store them in one place so that scientists have the information they need to conduct research and learn about new ways to predict, identify and treat illness, specifically those related to obesity and diabetes.

detailed_description.textblock: This protocol is designed to actively collect biospecimens (specifically, tissue from the neck region) and clinical data for donation to the TRI-MD, specifically, Dr. Sparks' laboratory. These specimens and data will be available to Dr. Sparks for future research activity in accordance with the Florida Hospital and Translational Research Institute for Metabolism and Diabetes (TRI) policies.

primary_outcome.measure: Collection of brown adipose neck tissue
primary_outcome.description: Any tissue deemed suitable by the surgeon and/or the research team during the neck surgery for the study's research objectives will be removed and collected for donation to this protocol. When there is enough tissue available, half will be snap frozen for extraction of DNA, RNA and protein. The other half will be cryopreserved for the future production of viable cells. When there is not enough tissue, the person collecting the samples will determine the processing. For research purposes, we aim to collect up to 500mg of each tissue.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Adults presenting for surgery in the neck area

intervention.intervention_name: Adults presenting for surgery in the neck area
intervention.arm_group_label: Adults presenting for surgery in the neck area

biospec_descr.textblock: Muscle and adipose tissue from the neck region, and blood samples

study_pop.textblock: This is a protocol for the collection of muscle and adipose tissues from patients of Dr. Alric Simmonds undergoing surgery in the neck region as part of their clinical care. In addition to the tissues collected at the time of the procedure, these patients will also be asked to provide additional blood samples before their procedure either at their pre-operative visit or on the morning of the surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults aged 18 and older presenting for surgery in the neck area
- Able to provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to provide informed consent

overall_official.affiliation: Translational Research Institute for Metabolism and Diabetes

facility.name: Translational Research Institute for Metabolism and Diabetes

link.description: Florida Hospital Translational Research Institute for Metabolism and Diabetes
